comment: I don't understand the bad reviews. He was so kind and cared enough to go further into detail if you had a question. He cares about his students and calls on them by name, he encourages class discussion and states his opinion on the subject once the students finished discussing. His class was easy and he is very helpful, take him and ask questions!

Was not impressed with Professor Morakinyo. Lecture is just him reading off of the slides, which are posted on D2L, you get no knew information by attending class. There are no assignments only quizzes, and I think there were only 8 total. No cushioning your grade. Fail one, your grade would probably drop a letter grade.

Difficult to understand concepts he lectures on, and he is very biased when teaching about capitalism/socialism. Heavy propaganda class. On the positive, he is very passionate and engaging with the class and encourages discussion. Easy quizzes, but watch out for trick questions. I did not learn much from this class/professor

If you are a duel enrollment student DON'T TAKE THIS PROF'S CLASS!!! He only has 8 tests trough the year and his final is 40% of your grade! His tests are also nonsensical, half of the questions are trick questions! Only teacher I have ever struggled with getting even a B in the class of.

This professor truly does care about his students and the topic he teaches. I missed a quiz once due to some circumstances and he was very understanding and reopened it. However, he does not respond to emails and it can become quite hard to understand him at times due to his accent. He does provide great opportunities for extra credit.

Dumb quizzes, great lectures, extra credit opportunities outside of class that might conflict w schedule, fine final exam. You don't need to read the textbook but definitely do the practice questions. He responds to emails bout a week later but is nice. He loves his job.

Very engaging lectures and he and makes sure everybody gets it before he moves on. He literally says "This will be on the quiz so pay attention." His accent effects the teaching maybe like 5-10% so people are clearly exaggerating. Also extra credit. 

It'd be amazing if you manage to fail this class. You'd have to try hard to get LESS then a B.

the class consists only of quizzes and some extra credit opportunities. I literally only went to class once and did just fine in the class. If this class is important to you though I would probably get a better professor.

first of all, those complaining about his accent are 100% exaggerating lol. his accent isn't even that thick or bad. secondly, his quizzes are all online open note but IRRELEVANT to his powerpoints and lectures. literally a self-teach class. i honestly stopped showing up after a month. passionate for economics, but you can find way better than him.

People complain about his accent, but it isn't bad. Loves what he teaches and is passionate about it. Offers a lot of extra credit. All grades come from online quizzes that are questions directly from the PowerPoints. If you engage with him about a topic he will go into detail about it. Only downside is he doesn't respond to emails or texts.

Good at teaching, okay and he will repeat himself. However he's so unorganized in what he's doing  
 and does not respond to emails
Cool guy and very willing to provide extra credit. Pay attention in lecture and you should do fine on the quizzes. He drops the lowest quiz.

Ever body rated him badly for his accent, because that made it difficult to understand him, but except that he has a great personality. I like that he always tried his best to explain things. His final exam is outside of class and very difficult, it requires lockdown browser with webcam. Even after getting 87 in final exam, my grade from A to B+
He's very good at explaining things during lectures. Most grades come from D2L quizzes and the other from one group project and the final exam.

I loved Professor Morakinyo. He clearly loves what he does and he wants us to also love the topic. He gives chances for extra credit by attending guest lectures. He provides us with slideshow notes and we also have to read the online book. He gives you A LOT of chances to complete your work. He truly does want you to succeed.

This class is mostly based on quizzes for which you can use the textbook or the slides. There is also a group project which everyone scored an 80 or above, and then the final was simple and only had 40 questions. This professor makes you learn to do work on your own, but is caring, helpful, and receptive to feedback when needed.

I really enjoyed taking the class as the teacher has a great passion for what he teaches. Every lecture was very engaging and Professor Morakinyo is very nice to work with. There aren't many assignments and the quizzes are good for learning. Overall, I would take the class over again if I could.

Don't believe every review you see he was a very nice professor. I believe his class is very easy to pass. There are 8 quizzes which are ALL ONLINE with open notes. All the answers to these quizzes are in his powerpoints. Although he has a thick accent this is something he can't help and he further more explains things if you didn't understand.

Terrible lectures, terrible quizzes, horrible final exam, horrible wording and he doesn't respond to emails. Final is lockdown browsered even though this is an online exam and no other classes do that...

Very strong accent hard to understand but I just took not for the slides. One group project with vague instructions. 8 quizzes 10 questions each with no lockdown or monitor. One final 45 questions same thing. I honestly never showed up after a few weeks because I took economics in high school and I did fine.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Morakinyo is passionate about teaching and funny, but lectures are very hard to understand due to the accent, and the class is very textbook heavy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Mr. M shows his passion to teach econ but just doesant do it very well. His accent makes it hard to understand him and hes not much of a tech person. He takes a while to reply to emails and doesant really show that he cares for the students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He's funny and I enjoyed the lectures at the beginning. He isn't that hard to understand and if you ask him to repeat himself he will. Only grades were quizzes(open note), guest lectures & final exam(lockdown+webcam) You have to attend 4 guest lectures(all on campus) Final exam was VERY hard, my A dropped to a B. he's cool but would not take again.

He was very confusing and hard to understand. All the quizzes and test come pretty much from the textbook so there is a lot of reading. This is basically a self teach class. Would not recommend anyone to take him unless you absolutely have to.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: He does a very poor job of explaining concepts and the quizzes are not even over stuff reviewed in class. He seems to operate on a very last minute basis and never seems to know to explain economics. He does engage the class so at times it's not totally boring but overall I do not recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is not very good at explaining the course material and makes his test harder than necessary. Don't take him if you like teachers who teach well.

Stay away from this professor, I mean it! In all my years of college I have never experienced a more disorganized and difficult professor. Test dates change on a whim and do not at all reflect the syllabus, as well he grades the tests very harshly considering he does not know what he is teaching about. Do not take him, you will thank me later!

Hands down the worst professor I have ever had. He doesn't even know what he is teaching or how to use the school website. Strays from the syllabus and you never know when the tests are going to be because of this. He will say its on one day and then never make it available and then gives you 1 hour notice of when it actually is.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Absolute worst professor I have ever had. Run away. He does not even know the content he is teaching. He would promise that we would all make A's on an exam that was going to be "super easy" then the whole class would fail. He curved nothing even when the class average was 50. This buffoon tanked my GPA.

I literally hated this class. At the beginning of the semester, he said there would be days and times (not the usual class time) to attend optional guest lectures to receive extra credit . He then made it mandatory which is ridiculous because we have other classes at those times. I couldnt attend those bc I had work or class and I got a freakin C

Almost a whole letter grade is dependent on going to guest lectures outside of scheduled class hours, it was stated as extra credit at the beginning of class but changed to mandatory when he updated the syllabus half way through the semester. The things discussed in the lecture have really nothing to do with anything that's on the quizzes and test.

He was hard to understand, but he did explain topics fully. I only went for the first few weeks, then I stopped going because the power points and textbooks were online. However, his power points were sometimes overlapped by the text. There was only 8 quizzes and a final(with a webcam) all online. So if you do bad on some of it, you may not pass.
